functions.name: centerWindow

params.name: path
params.description: The path of the window to center on screen

functions.description: Centers the given window on the screen.

functions.name: closeParentWindow

params.name: event
params.description: A component event object. The enclosing window of the event's source component will be closed

functions.description: Closes the parent window of the component that fired the given event.
functions.long_description: Convenience function that closes the window containing the component that triggered the event. Commonly used on 'Close' or 'Cancel' buttons in popup windows.

functions.name: closeWindow

params.name: path
params.description: The path of the window to close

functions.description: Closes the window with the given path.

functions.name: desktop

params.name: handle
params.description: The handle for the desktop to target. Omit for the primary desktop

returns.description: A navigation utilities proxy configured for the specified desktop, with all standard system.nav methods

functions.description: Returns a navigation proxy for a specific desktop, enabling multi-monitor window management.
functions.long_description: Returns an INavUtilities object that proxies all system.nav operations to a specific desktop. In multi-monitor Vision Client setups, each monitor can have a separate desktop with its own window stack. Pass the desktop handle to target a specific one, or omit it for the primary desktop.

functions.name: getCurrentWindow

returns.description: The path of the current maximized main-screen window

functions.description: Returns the path of the currently displayed main-screen window.

functions.name: goBack
functions.description: Navigates back to the previous main-screen window in the navigation history.
functions.long_description: Uses the Typical Navigation Strategy to swap to the previously displayed main-screen window. Works like a browser's back button for Vision Client windows.

functions.name: goForward
functions.description: Navigates forward to the next main-screen window after a goBack() call.
functions.long_description: Uses the Typical Navigation Strategy to navigate forward in the window history. Only works after a previous goBack() call, similar to a browser's forward button.

functions.name: goHome
functions.description: Navigates to the configured home window using the Typical Navigation Strategy.

functions.name: openWindow

params.name: path
params.description: The path of the window to open

params.name: params
params.description: Key-value pairs to set as dynamic properties on the target window's root container

returns.description: A reference to the opened window object

functions.description: Opens the window at the given path, or brings it to front if already open.
functions.long_description: Opens a window by path. If the window is already open, it is brought to front. The params dictionary enables parameterized windows — keys must match dynamic property names on the window's root container. The returned Window object can be used to modify window properties like size.

functions.name: openWindowInstance

params.name: path
params.description: The path of the window to open a new instance of

params.name: params
params.description: Key-value pairs to set as dynamic properties on the target window's root container

returns.description: A reference to the newly opened window instance

functions.description: Opens a new window instance even if the window is already open.
functions.long_description: Unlike openWindow() which brings an existing window to front, this function always creates a new instance. Useful for popup windows that need multiple simultaneous copies — e.g., showing HMI faceplates for multiple pieces of equipment side by side. No limit on the number of instances.

functions.name: swapTo

params.name: path
params.description: The path of the window to swap to

params.name: params
params.description: Key-value pairs to set as dynamic properties on the target window's root container

returns.description: A reference to the window that was navigated to

functions.description: Swaps from the current main-screen window to the specified window.
functions.long_description: Performs a window swap from the current main-screen window to the target window. The current window is closed and the target is opened in its place. Unlike swapWindow(), you don't need to specify the source — it is automatically determined as the current main-screen window.

functions.name: swapWindow

params.name: swapFromPath
params.description: The path of the window to close, or a component event whose enclosing window will be closed

params.name: swapToPath
params.description: The path of the window to open

params.name: params
params.description: Key-value pairs to set as dynamic properties on the target window's root container

returns.description: A reference to the newly opened window

functions.description: Closes one window and opens another in a single swap operation.
functions.long_description: Performs an atomic window swap: closes the source window and opens the target. The source can be specified as a window path string or a component event object (whose enclosing window is used). Supports passing parameters to the target window's root container dynamic properties.
